intro: Kohautia baddadensis, commonly known as the Baddadensis spurge, is a perennial flowering plant native to the arid regions of the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many species with milky sap and showy flowers. The plant is characterized by its compact growth habit, with small, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its native habitat.
